intro: Erigeron capensis, commonly known as the Cape fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with narrow, linear leaves. Erigeron capensis is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
